subject: Sales
title: Negotiating by Email
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Negotiating by Email.

hook.text: You send a proposal by email. The reply says: 'We need to discuss this.' Momentum gone.

buildup.text: Email strips away tone, body language, and pacing. Misunderstandings multiply quickly.

discovery.text: Studies show email negotiations produce worse average outcomes than face-to-face conversations.

twist.text: But email offers thinking time. No pressure to respond instantly. Silence isn't awkward in text.

climax.text: Use email for proposals and documentation. Save phone or video for relationship and concessions.

punchline.text: Email works for offers. Calls work for deals.

quiz.question: What is the biggest weakness of email negotiation?
options: It removes tone and body language
